column4: i ended up --purging all the alsa and pulseaudio stuf and doing this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenSound
i also installed other supporting packages
similar problem? audio skipping in music and video?
esound-clients esound-common libasound2 libasound2-plugins linux-sound-base and flashplugin-nonfree-extrasound
no.. since alsa has dropped alsaconf  alsa could not figure out that my sound was an ac97 not an nvidia chipset
but it may help anyway?
because I'm almost at "whatever it takes"
i think so
i like oss
it just worked
less modules less memory
get the deb http://www.opensound.com/download.cgi
thanks, that's encouraging
and follow the directions https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenSound
try to uninstall that other stuff with dpkg --purge if you can... short of uninstalling other desktop apps
did you pay for OSS??
no
is that just for longer support, or what?
i don't know.. haven't got any email or anything from them
how long ago did you switch?
they have a freenode channel too  #oss
ooh!
right after i installed jaunty and i have all the upgrades current
